Completion of Minimum University Require: Minimum 120 credits and minimum GPA of 2.0
Completion of 45 upper-level credits, residence requirement, Writing Intensive requirement, and General Education requirement

Major Requirements: Minimum 81 credits. Students complete the Paramedic Concentration in 129-132 total credits.
Minimum grade of 'C' in courses applied to the major
Completion of one of the following concentrations: Management, Paramedic

Students without a current, acceptable E: EHS 202 - Clinical Concepts and Practice I (3)
EHS 203 - Clinical Concepts and Practice II (3)

Complete the following:: EHS 200 - Concepts of Emergency Health Services (3)
or EHS 200Y - Concepts of Emergency Health Services (4)
EHS 350 - Supervision and Operations in Emergency Health Service Systems (3)
EHS 351 - Financial Management, Budgeting and Resource Allocation for Emergency Health Administrators. (3)
EHS 360 - Instructional Concepts in Emergency Health Services (3)
EHS 430 - Research Topics in Emergency Health Services (3)

Complete one course from the following:: STAT 121 - Introduction to Statistics for the Social Sciences (4)
STAT 350 - Statistics with Applications in the Biological Sciences (4)

Emergency Health Services Concentration: Complete one of the following concentrations:
Management Concentration: The Management Concentration consists of the core requirements of the Emergency Health Services, B.S. and a minimum of 47 credits in the concentration. Depending on their interests and career goals, students are encouraged to consider a program offered by Political Science such as the Public Administration/Policy Minor or Public Administration and Policy Certificate.

Complete the following 22 credits:: POLI 250 - Introduction to Public Administration and Policy (3)

Complete the following 9 credits:: POLI 354 - Public Management and Personnel Systems (3)
SOCY 351 - Sociology of Health, Illness, and Medicine (3)

Complete the following 6 credits:: EHS 311 - Stress and Burnout: Personal and Professional Issues (3)
EHS 400 - Emergency Health Services Theory and Practice (3)

Complete 7 to 15 credits of internship:: EHS 450 - Emergency Health Services Practicum and Seminar (3-15)

Paramedic Concentration: The Paramedic Concentration consists of the core requirements of the Emergency Health Services, B.S. and a minimum of 76 credits in the concentration. Students pursuing the Paramedic Concentration must be EMT certified and provide documentation of a minimum of 100 patient contacts by the fall of junior year.

Complete 3 or 4 credits from the followi: BIOL 141 - Foundations of Biology: Cells, Energy and Organisms (4)

Complete the following 8 credits:: BIOL 251 - Human Anatomy and Physiology I (3)
BIOL 251L - Human Anatomy and Physiology I Laboratory (1)
BIOL 252 - Human Anatomy and Physiology II (3)
BIOL 252L - Human Anatomy and Physiology II Laboratory. (1)

Complete 9 or 10 credits from one of the:
and CHEM 102 - Principles of Chemistry II (4)
and CHEM 102L - Introductory Chemistry Lab I (2)
CHEM 123 - Introduction to General Organic and Biochemistry I (4)

and CHEM 124 - Introduction to General Organic and Biochemistry II (3) 
and CHEM 124L - General Organic and Biochemistry Lab (2)

Complete the following 46 credits:: EHS 464 - Advanced Cardiac and Respiratory Emergencies (3)
EHS 481 - ALS Field and Clinical Experience I (3)
EHS 482 - ALS Field and Clinical Experience II (4)
EHS 483 - ALS Field and Clinical Experience III (6)
EHS 484 - ALS Field and Clinical Experience IV (6)

Complete 3 credits from the following:: EHS 311 - Stress and Burnout: Personal and Professional Issues (3)
EHS 330 - Management of Search and Rescue Operations (3)
